inputFields.description: ID of the transaction to be captured.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description:
Deprecated: This field is included for supporting legacy clients. Please use `transaction.amount` instead.

The amount to capture on the transaction. Must be greater than 0. You can't capture more than the authorized amount unless your industry and processor support settlement adjustment (capturing a certain percentage over the authorized amount); [contact us for assistance](https://help.braintreepayments.com?issue=TransactionProcessingQuestion). If you capture an amount that is less than what was authorized, the transaction object will return the amount captured.

types.description: Input fields for a capture, with details that will define the resulting transaction.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount to capture on the transaction. Must be greater than 0. You can't capture more than the authorized amount unless your industry and processor support settlement adjustment (capturing a certain percentage over the authorized amount); [contact us for assistance](https://help.braintreepayments.com?issue=TransactionProcessingQuestion). If you capture an amount that is less than what was authorized, the transaction object will return the amount captured.

inputFields.name: descriptor
inputFields.description: Fields used to define what will appear on a customer's bank statement for a specific purchase. If specified, this will update the existing descriptor on the transaction.

inputFields.name: discountAmount
inputFields.description:
Discount amount that was included in the total transaction amount. Does not add to the total amount the payment method will be charged. This value can't be negative. Please note that this field is not used on PayPal transactions.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: lineItems
inputFields.description:
Line items for this transaction. Up to 249 line items may be specified.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: Additional information about the transaction. On PayPal transactions, this field maps to the PayPal invoice number. PayPal invoice numbers must be unique in your PayPal business account. Maximum 255 characters or 127 for PayPal transactions. If specified, this will update the existing order ID on the transaction.

inputFields.name: purchaseOrderNumber
inputFields.description:
A purchase order identification value you associate with this transaction.

*Required for Level 2 processing*.

inputFields.name: shipping
inputFields.description:
Shipping information.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: tax
inputFields.description:
Tax information about the transaction.

*Required for Level 2 processing*.

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date that the funds associated with this transaction were disbursed.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amount of money disbursed in the settlement currency, which may be different than the transaction's [presentment currency](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/get-started/currencies).

fields.name: exchangeRate
fields.description: The exchange rate from the presentment currency to the settlement currency. If the currencies are the same, this will be 1.

fields.name: fundsHeld
fields.description: Indicates whether funds have been withheld from a disbursement to the merchant's account.

types.name: DisplayItemType

types.name: Dispute
types.description: [A case raised by a customer to either request information about or to challenge a charge](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/risk-and-security/chargebacks-retrievals/overview). These are initiated via a customer's payment provider, such as their bank, and require a merchant to provide evidence or further information.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier.

fields.name: legacyId
fields.description: Legacy unique identifier.

fields.name: amountDisputed
fields.description: The amount of money from the original charge that the customer is disputing. Can be 0. This amount is debited from a merchant's account and held in a third-party account until the dispute is resolved, at which time it is sent to either the merchant or customer.

fields.name: amountWon
fields.description: If an amount was disputed, the amount of money awarded back to the merchant if the dispute was reversed.

fields.name: caseNumber
fields.description: The case number for the dispute.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time at which the dispute was created.

fields.name: receivedDate
fields.description: Date the dispute was received by the merchant.

fields.name: referenceNumber
fields.description: The transaction reference number for the dispute.

fields.name: responseDeadline
fields.description: The deadline for the merchant to submit a response to the dispute.

fields.name: replyByDate
fields.description: The reply by date for the merchant to submit a response to the dispute.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of dispute.

fields.name: evidence
fields.description: Evidence records submitted by the merchant for the dispute.

fields.name: originalDispute
fields.description: If this dispute is a follow-up to a previous chargeback or retrieval, the original dispute.

fields.name: processorResponse
fields.description: Additional information from the payment processor.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the dispute.

fields.name: statusHistory
fields.description: A log of history events containing status changes by date for this dispute.

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: The disputed transaction which the customer is either requesting further information on or challenging.

fields.name: chargebackProtectionLevel
fields.description: The chargeback protection status of the dispute.

fields.name: protectionLevel

fields.name: preDisputeProgram

types.name: Duration
types.description: An [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) Duration that accepts Days, Hours, Minutes and Seconds.

types.name: ECommerceIndicator
types.description: A card brand-specific two-digit string describing the mode of the transaction.

types.name: EmailAddress
types.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
minLength: 3 maxLength: 254 pattern: ^.+@[^\"\\-].+$.

types.name: EmvCardOriginDetails
types.description: Additional information about an integrated circuit card (ICC) payment method supplied by an in-store payment reader.

fields.name: authorizationMode

fields.description: An indicator for whether the transaction was verified via pin.

fields.name: inputMode
fields.description: The input mode used on the payment reader to facilitate an in-store transaction.

fields.name: terminalId
fields.description: The ID of the terminal that was processed this transaction.

fields.name: applicationPreferredName
fields.description: The preferred name associated with the application used to process an EMV transaction.

fields.name: applicationIdentifier
fields.description: The identifier specifying which EMV application was used to process the transaction.

fields.name: terminalVerificationResult
fields.description: A status code representing the result of a series of validations performed against an EMV enabled credit card.

fields.name: cardSequenceNumber
fields.description: A unique identifier for credit cards that share the same PAN.

fields.name: applicationInterchangeProfile
fields.description: An indicator of the credit card's capabilities within the processing application.

fields.name: terminalTransactionDate
fields.description: The local date that the transaction requested authorization from the payment reader, formatted YYMMDD.

fields.name: terminalTransactionType
fields.description: An indicator of the type of transaction specified during authorization processing.

fields.name: cashbackAmount
fields.description: An additional amount associated with the transaction that represents the cashback amount requested by the cardholder.

fields.name: applicationUsageControl
fields.description: An indicator used to specify an issuer's restrictions for processing in a geographic region.

fields.name: terminalCountryCode
fields.description: The country code indicated by the payment reader to process the transaction with.

fields.name: applicationCryptogram
fields.description: The cryptogram provided by an integrated circuit card (ICC) used for processing the transaction.

fields.name: cryptogramInformationData
fields.description: An indicator for the type of application cryptogram provided by an integrated circuit card (ICC) to process the transaction.

fields.name: cardholderVerificationMethodResults
fields.description: An indicator of the cardholder verification method and if it was successful or unsuccessful.

fields.name: applicationTransactionCounter
fields.description: A counter managed by an integrated circuit card (ICC) that provides a reference to each transaction using that card.

fields.name: unpredictableNumber
fields.description: A value used to uniquely differentiate an application cryptogram used during authorization processing.

fields.name: issuerActionCodeDefault
fields.description: An indicator of the conditions that caused a transaction to be offline declined by the issuer, in a scenario where the transaction may have authorized if the payment reader made a processor request but was unable to.

fields.name: issuerActionCodeDenial
fields.description: An indicator of the conditions that caused a transaction to be offline declined by the issuer, in a scenario where the payment reader did not attempt to make a processor request.

fields.name: issuerActionCodeOnline
fields.description: An indicator of the conditions that caused the payment reader to attempt to make a processor request.

types.name: ExchangeRate
types.description: A value with more than one decimal place, representing an exchange rate between currencies. For example, `0.93014065558374`. minLength: 3 pattern: ^\\d+[.]\\d+$

types.name: ExchangeRateQuote
types.description: Details of the generated exchange rate quote.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier, which must be passed in the payment request in order to honor the exchange rate during settlement.

fields.name: baseAmount
fields.description: The amount in the `baseCurrency` to be converted to the `quoteCurrency`. If no amount was provided, then this amount is 1 unit of `baseCurrency`.

fields.name: quoteAmount
fields.description:
The amount in the `quoteCurrency` converted from the `baseCurrency`.
If no amount was provided, then this amount is converted from 1 unit of `baseCurrency`, which will be the same as `exchangeRate` after rounding-off.

fields.name: exchangeRate
fields.description:
This much of `quoteCurrency` is required to buy 1 unit of `baseCurrency`. This includes merchant `markupPercentage` if any.
If a `markupPercentage` is specified, this field will be the sum of that percentage and the `tradeRate`.

fields.name: tradeRate
fields.description: This is the rate at which PayPal will settle with the merchant.

fields.name: expiresAt
fields.description: When the exchange rate quote represents expires.

fields.name: refreshesAt
fields.description: When the exchange rate quote represents will be refreshed.

types.name: ExchangeRateQuoteInput
types.description: Input to generate the exchange rate quote.

inputFields.name: baseCurrency
inputFields.description: The currency code from which the exchange rate will be used to convert to the `quoteCurrency`.

inputFields.name: quoteCurrency
inputFields.description: The currency code to which the exchange rate will be used to convert from `baseCurrency`.

inputFields.name: baseAmount
inputFields.description: The amount in the `baseCurrency` to be converted to the `quoteCurrency`. If this is provided, the result will include the converted amount properly rounded.

inputFields.name: markup
inputFields.description: A percentage added into the exchange rate. This allows the merchant to settle for more than the quoted `tradeRate`.

A positive value is north of the equator, a negative value is south of the equator.

A positive value is east of the prime meridian, a negative value is west of the prime meridian.

fields.description: Charge a PayPal account and return a payload that includes details of the resulting transaction.

fields.name: chargeVenmoAccount

fields.description: Charge a credit card of any origin and return a payload that includes details of the resulting transaction.

fields.name: vaultPaymentMethod
fields.description: Vault payment information from a single-use payment method and return a payload that includes a new multi-use payment method. When vaulting a credit card, by default, this mutation will also verify that card before vaulting.

fields.name: vaultUsBankAccount
fields.description: Vault payment information from a single-use US bank account payment method and return a payload that includes a new multi-use payment method.

fields.name: vaultCreditCard
fields.description: Vault payment information from a single-use credit card and return a payload that includes a new multi-use payment method. By default, this mutation will also verify the card before vaulting.

fields.name: refundTransaction
fields.description: Refund a settled transaction and return a payload that includes details of the refund.

fields.name: reverseTransaction
fields.description: Reverse a transaction and return a payload that includes either the voided transaction or a refund.

fields.name: reverseRefund
fields.description: Reverse a refund and return a payload that includes voided refund.

fields.name: refundCreditCard
fields.description:
Create a detached refund (unassociated with any previous Braintree payment) to a credit card and return a payload that includes details of the refund.

We have previously referred to this as issuing a "detached credit," and it is disallowed by default. See the [documentation](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/transactions/refunds-voids-credits#detached-credits) for more information regarding eligibility and configuration.

fields.name: refundUsBankAccount
fields.description:
Create a detached refund (unassociated with any previous Braintree payment) to a  US Bank Account and return a payload that includes details of the refund.

We have previously referred to this as issuing a "detached credit," and it is disallowed by default. See the [documentation](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/transactions/refunds-voids-credits#detached-credits) for more information regarding eligibility and configuration.

fields.name: updateTransactionCustomFields

fields.description: Run a verification on a multi-use payment method.

types.name: PartialCaptureTransactionInput
types.description: Top-level input fields for capturing outstanding funds authorized by a transaction.

inputFields.name: clientMutationId
inputFields.description: An identifier used to reconcile requests and responses. 255 characters maximum.

inputFields.name: transactionId
inputFields.description: ID of the original authorized transaction to be partially captured.

inputFields.name: transaction
inputFields.description: Input fields for the capture, with details that will define the resulting capture transaction.

types.name: PartialCaptureTransactionOptionsInput
types.description: Input fields for the capture, with details that will define the resulting capture transaction.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount to capture on the transaction against the parent authorization transaction. Must be greater than 0. You can perform multiple partial capture transactions as long as the cumulative amount of those transactions is less than or equal to the amount authorized by the parent transaction. You can't capture more than the authorized amount unless your industry and processor support settlement adjustment (capturing a certain percentage over the authorized amount); [contact us for assistance](https://help.braintreepayments.com?issue=TransactionProcessingQuestion).

inputFields.name: discountAmount
inputFields.description:
Discount amount that was included in the total transaction amount. Does not add to the total amount the payment method will be charged. This value can't be negative. Please note that this field is not on PayPal transactions.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: lineItems
inputFields.description:
Line items for this transaction. Up to 249 line items may be specified.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: Additional information about the transaction. On PayPal transactions, this field maps to the PayPal invoice number. PayPal invoice numbers must be unique in your PayPal business account. Maximum 255 characters or 127 for PayPal transactions. If specified, this will update the existing order ID on the transaction.

inputFields.name: purchaseOrderNumber
inputFields.description:
A purchase order identification value you associate with this transaction.

*Required for Level 2 processing*.

inputFields.name: shipping
inputFields.description:
Shipping information.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: tax
inputFields.description:
Tax information about the transaction.

*Required for Level 2 processing*.

inputFields.name: descriptor
inputFields.description: Fields used to define what will appear on a customer's bank statement for a specific purchase. If specified, this will update the existing descriptor on the transaction.

types.name: Payment
types.description: A merchant-initiated movement of money between the merchant and a customer, by way of a payment method. Payments can represent money moving either from a customer to the merchant by charging a payment method (a Transaction), or from the merchant back to a customer by refunding a previous transaction (a Refund).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier.

fields.name: legacyId
fields.description: Legacy unique identifier.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the payment was created.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount charged or credited to the payment method. Note that in the case of a Transaction, this amount will represent the amount moving from the customer to the merchant, and in the case of a Refund, will represent the amount moving from the merchant back to the customer.

fields.name: orderId
fields.description: The order ID.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of this payment.

fields.name: statusHistory
fields.description: The records of all statuses this payment has passed through, with additional information on why each status occurred. Returned in reverse chronological order, with the most recent event first in the list.

fields.name: merchantAccountId
fields.description: The ID of the merchant account that processed this payment.

fields.name: source
fields.description: How the payment was created.

fields.name: paymentMethodSnapshot
fields.description: Snapshot of payment method details used to create the payment, preserved at the time the transaction was created. This will always be present.

enumValues.name: RECURRING
enumValues.description: Transactions that are initiated by the merchant for subsequent recurring payments (e.g. subscriptions with a fixed amount on a predefined schedule).

enumValues.name: RECURRING_FIRST
enumValues.description: Transactions initiated by the customer that represent the first in a series of recurring payments or subscription.

enumValues.name: UNSCHEDULED
enumValues.description: Transactions that are initiated by the merchant for unscheduled payments that are not recurring on a predefined schedule or amount (e.g. balance top-up).

types.name: PaymentSearchType
types.description: The type of a Payment, based primarily on implementing type.

enumValues.name: DETACHED_REFUND
enumValues.description: Only use this field if you have processed [detached credits](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/transactions/refunds-voids-credits#detached-credits). The payment is a Refund, and represents a refund of a transaction not processed through your Braintree account.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description: The payment is a Refund, and represents a refund of a transaction present in this Braintree account. Unless you have processed any [detached credits](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/transactions/refunds-voids-credits#detached-credits), this type encompasses all refunds.

enumValues.name: TRANSACTION
enumValues.description: The payment is a Transaction.

types.name: PaymentSource
types.description: The origin of a request that created or changed a transaction or refund.

types.name: PaymentStatus
types.description: The status of the payment, indicating its success or failure, and where it is in its [lifecycle](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/get-started/transaction-lifecycle). For further details on why any given status occurred, consult the corresponding `PaymentStatusEvent` in the payment's `statusHistory`.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION_EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The transaction spent too much time in the `AUTHORIZED` status and was marked as expired. Expiration [time frames](https://developers.braintreepayments.com/reference/general/statuses#authorization-expired) differ by card type, transaction type, and, in some cases, merchant category.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The processor authorized the transaction, putting your customer's funds on hold. Your customer may see a pending charge on his or her account. However, before the customer is actually charged and before you receive the funds, you must use the `captureTransaction` mutation. If you do not want to capture the transaction, you should use the `reverseTransaction` mutation to avoid a misuse of authorization fee.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZING
enumValues.description: If a payment remains in a status of `AUTHORIZING`, [contact us for assistance](https://help.braintreepayments.com?issue=TransactionProcessingQuestion).

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: An error occurred when sending the payment to the downstream processor. See the payment's `statusHistory` for the exact error.

enumValues.name: GATEWAY_REJECTED
enumValues.description: The transaction was [rejected](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/transactions/gateway-rejections) based on one or more settings or rules in your Braintree gateway. See the transaction's `statusHistory` to determine which resulted in the decline.

enumValues.name: PROCESSOR_DECLINED
enumValues.description: The processor declined the transaction while attempting to authorize it. See the transaction's `statusHistory` to determine what reason the processor gave for the decline.

enumValues.name: SETTLED
enumValues.description: The payment has been settled. For transactions, this means your customer has been charged and the process of disbursing the funds to your bank account has begun. For refunds, it means that the process of disbursing funds back to the customer has begun.

enumValues.name: SETTLEMENT_CONFIRMED
enumValues.description: The transaction was captured partially and will not be submitted to processor for settling. Its child transaction(s) has been successfully captured and will be included in the next settlement batch.

enumValues.name: SETTLEMENT_DECLINED
enumValues.description: The processor declined the payment while attempting to capture it. See the payment's `statusHistory` to determine why it wasn't settled. This status is rare, and only certain types of transactions can be affected.

enumValues.name: SETTLEMENT_PENDING
enumValues.description: The transaction has not yet fully settled. This status is rare, and will generally resolve to a status of `SETTLED`. Only certain types of transactions can be affected.

enumValues.name: SETTLING
enumValues.description: The payment is in the process of being settled. This is a transitory state, and will resolve to a status of `SETTLED`.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED_FOR_SETTLEMENT
enumValues.description: The payment has been successfully captured, and will be included in the next settlement batch, at which time it will become settled.

enumValues.name: VOIDED
enumValues.description: The payment has been voided or canceled. For transactions, this means it's no longer authorized, your customer's funds are no longer on hold, and you can't use the `captureTransaction` mutation on this transaction. For refunds, it means the customer will not receive the funds from the refund.

types.name: PaymentStatusEvent

fields.name: amount

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source that caused the status event to occur.

fields.name: terminal
fields.description: Whether this is the final state for the payment. If false, this transaction will pass into another subsequent state.

inputFields.name: dataOnlyRequested
inputFields.description: When set to true, the data-only 3D Secure call will be created. The status of [DATA_ONLY_SUCCESSFUL](https://developers.braintreepayments.com/guides/3d-secure/advanced-options#using-data-only-3d-secure) will be returned as `ThreeDSecureAuthenticationStatus` for a successful response.

inputFields.name: cardAdd
inputFields.description: If set to true, a card-add challenge will be requested from the issuer to confirm adding new card to the merchant's vault. This flag should only be used when adding a card to a merchant’s vault and not for creating transactions.

The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering
plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of
the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The

The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan
format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the
country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15
digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and
subscriber number (SN).

inputFields.name: authenticationId
inputFields.description: Braintree unique ID of the 3D Secure authentication performed for this transaction. You will only need to use this field if you are charging or authorizing a vaulted payment method ID.

inputFields.name: passThrough
inputFields.description: Results of a merchant-performed 3D Secure authentication. You will only need to use these fields if you've performed your own integration with a 3D Secure MPI provider (e.g. Cardinal Centinel). Otherwise, Braintree's SDKs handle this for you in our standard 3D Secure integration.

types.name: ThreeDSecureAuthenticationMerchantProductCode

types.name: ThreeDSecureAuthenticationShippingType
types.description: Indicates the shipping type for the transaction.

types.name: ThreeDSecureAuthenticationStatus
types.description: The 3D Secure authentication status of the card.

types.name: ThreeDSecureAuthenticationStatusIndicator
types.description: Indicates the current status of the 3D Secure authentication.

types.name: ThreeDSecureAuthenticationTransactionType
types.description: Indicates the type of transaction for 3D Secure authentication.

types.name: ThreeDSecureCardEnrolled
types.description: Indicates whether the card is enrolled in a 3D Secure program.

enumValues.name: BYPASS
enumValues.description: Authentication has been bypassed. This status will be returned if you set up bypass rules with CardinalCommerce, and they are triggered.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error in determining whether the card is enrolled in a 3D Secure program.

enumValues.name: NO
enumValues.description: The card is not enrolled.

enumValues.name: UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The DS (directory server) or ACS (access control server) is not available for authentication at the time of the request.

enumValues.name: YES
enumValues.description: The card is enrolled.

types.name: ThreeDSecureCavvAlgorithm
types.description: A 3D Secure CAVV algorithm. Possible Values: 2 - CVV with ATN, 3 - Mastercard SPA algorithm.

types.name: ThreeDSecureConfiguration
types.description: Configuration for 3D Secure.

fields.name: cardinalAuthenticationJWT
fields.description: Authentication information for initializing Cardinal's songbird.js library.

types.name: ThreeDSecureDetails
types.description: 3D Secure information for the payment method.

fields.name: authentication
fields.description: Contains relevant data fields if the payment method has been authenticated using 3D Secure. Only available on 3D Secure authenticated single-use payment methods and 3D Secure paymentMethodSnapshots.

fields.name: authenticationInsight
fields.description: Information about the [customer authentication regulation environment](https://developers.braintreepayments.com/guides/3d-secure/migration/javascript/v3#authentication-insight) that applies to the payment method when processed with the provided merchant account. This can be used to determine whether to perform 3D Secure authentication.

fields.name: cavv
fields.description: The cardholder authentication verification value. This value should be appended to the authorization message signifying that the transaction has been successfully authenticated with 3D Secure. This value will be encoded according to the merchant's configuration with CardinalCommerce, with either Base64 or Hex encoding. The decoded value will be of different length and format per card scheme.

fields.name: directoryServerTransactionId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the 3D Secure interaction with the card brand directory server.

fields.name: eciFlag
fields.description: The electronic commerce indicator.

fields.name: liabilityShifted
fields.description: A boolean indicating if the card has received liability shift.

fields.name: liabilityShiftPossible
fields.description: A boolean indicating if the card is eligible for liability shift.

fields.name: cardEnrolled
fields.description: Indicates whether the card is enrolled in a 3D Secure program.

fields.name: authenticationStatus
fields.description: The 3D Secure authentication status of the card.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the 3D Secure protocol used during authentication.

fields.name: xId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the 3D Secure interaction with the provider.

fields.name: threeDSecureServerTransactionId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the 3D Secure interaction with the 3D Secure server.

fields.name: acsTransactionId
fields.description: A unique identifier for the 3D Secure interaction with the access control server.

fields.name: paresStatus
fields.description: Indicates the current status of the 3D Secure authentication from the 3D Secure server for 3D Secure 1.0 authentications.

fields.name: transactionStatus
fields.description: Indicates the current status of the 3D Secure authentication from the 3D Secure server for 3D Secure 2.0 authentications.

fields.name: transactionStatusReason
fields.description: Indicates the reason for the transaction status. This will be null if status is `SUCCESSFUL_AUTHENTICATION`.

inputFields.description: Indicates the delivery timeframe if applicable.

inputFields.name: reorderIndicator
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the cardholder is reordering merchandise purchased in a previous order.

inputFields.name: preorderIndicator
inputFields.description: Indicates whether cardholder is placing an order with a future availability or release date.

inputFields.name: preorderDate
inputFields.description: Expected date that a pre-ordered purchase will be available.

inputFields.name: giftCardAmount
inputFields.description: The purchase amount total for prepaid gift cards.

inputFields.name: giftCardCurrencyCode
inputFields.description: ISO 4217 currency code for the gift card purchased.

inputFields.name: giftCardCount
inputFields.description: Total count of individual prepaid gift cards purchased.

inputFields.name: accountCreatedDuringTransaction
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the cardholder created the account during this transaction.

inputFields.name: accountCreateDate
inputFields.description: Date the cardholder opened the account.

inputFields.name: accountChangedDuringTransaction
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the cardholder changed the account during this transaction. This includes changes to the billing or shipping address, new payment accounts or new users added.

inputFields.name: accountChangeDate
inputFields.description: Date the cardholder's account was last changed. This includes changes to the billing or shipping address, new payment accounts or new users added.

inputFields.name: accountPasswordChangedDuringTransaction
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the cardholder changed or reset the password on the account during this transaction.

inputFields.name: accountPasswordChangeDate
inputFields.description: Date the cardholder changed or reset the password on the account.

inputFields.name: firstUseOfShippingAddress
inputFields.description: Indicates whether this transaction represents the first use of this shipping address.

inputFields.name: shippingAddressFirstUsageDate
inputFields.description: Date when the shipping address used for this transaction was first used.

inputFields.name: transactionCountDay
inputFields.description: Number of transactions (successful or incomplete) for this cardholder account within the last 24 hours.

inputFields.name: transactionCountYear
inputFields.description: Number of transactions (successful or incomplete) for this cardholder account within the last year.

inputFields.name: addCardAttempts
inputFields.description: Number of attempts that have been made to add a card to this account in the last 24 hours.

inputFields.name: accountPurchases
inputFields.description: Number of purchases with this cardholder account during the previous six months.

inputFields.name: suspiciousActivityObserved
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the merchant experienced suspicious activity (including previous fraud) on the account.

inputFields.name: accountNameMatchesShippingName
inputFields.description: Indicates if the cardholder name on the account is identical to the shipping name used for the transaction.

inputFields.name: paymentMethodAddedDuringTransaction
inputFields.description: Indicates whether the payment method was added to the cardholder account during this transaction.

inputFields.name: paymentMethodAddedToAccountDate
inputFields.description: Date the payment method was added to the cardholder account.

inputFields.name: acsWindowSize
inputFields.description: An override field that a merchant can pass in to set the challenge window size to display to the end cardholder. The ACS will reply with content that is formatted appropriately to this window size to allow for the best user experience. The sizes are width x height in pixels of the window displayed in the cardholder browser window.

inputFields.name: sdkMaxTimeout
inputFields.description: This field indicates the maximum amount of time for all 3DS 2.0 messages to be communicated between all components (in minutes). Minimum is 05. Defaults to 15.

inputFields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
inputFields.description: Indicates whether cardholder billing and shipping addresses match.

inputFields.name: accountId
inputFields.description: Additional cardholder account information.

inputFields.name: ipAddress
inputFields.description: The IP address of the cardholder. Both IPv4 and IPv6 formats are supported.

inputFields.name: orderDescription
inputFields.description: Brief Description of items purchased.

inputFields.name: taxAmount
inputFields.description: Tax amount.

inputFields.name: userAgent
inputFields.description: The exact content of the HTTP user agent header.

inputFields.name: installment
inputFields.description: Indicates the maximum number of authorizations for installment payments. An integer value greater than 1 indicating the maximum number of permitted authorizations for installment payments.

inputFields.name: purchaseDate
inputFields.description: Datetime of original purchase.

inputFields.name: recurringEnd
inputFields.description: The date after which no further recurring authorizations should be performed.

inputFields.name: recurringFrequency
inputFields.description: Integer value indicating the minimum number of days between recurring authorizations. A frequency of monthly is indicated by the value 28. Multiple of 28 days will be used to indicate months. Example: 6 months = 168.

types.name: ThreeDSecurePassThroughInput
types.description: Results of a merchant-performed 3D Secure authentication.

inputFields.name: eciFlag
inputFields.description: The value of the electronic commerce indicator (ECI) flag, which indicates the outcome of the 3D Secure authentication.

inputFields.name: cavv
inputFields.description: Cardholder authentication verification value or CAVV. The main encrypted message issuers and card networks use to verify authentication has occurred. Mastercard uses an AVV (Authentication Verification Value) message and American Express uses an AEVV (American Express Verification Value) message, each of which should also be passed in the cavv parameter.

inputFields.name: xId
inputFields.description: Transaction identifier resulting from 3D Secure authentication. Uniquely identifies the transaction and sometimes required in the authorization message. Must be base64-encoded. This field will no longer be used in 3D Secure 2 authentications.

inputFields.name: threeDSecureServerTransactionId
inputFields.description: 3D Secure server transaction identifier resulting from 3D Secure authentication.

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description: The version of 3D Secure authentication used for the transaction. Required on Visa and Mastercard authentications.

inputFields.name: authenticationResponse
inputFields.description: The 3D Secure authentication response status code.

inputFields.name: directoryServerResponse
inputFields.description: The 3D Secure directory server response.

inputFields.name: cavvAlgorithm
inputFields.description: The algorithm used to generate the CAVV value. This is only returned for Mastercard SecureCode transactions (3DS 1.0).

inputFields.name: directoryServerTransactionId
inputFields.description: A unique identifier for the 3D Secure 2 interaction with the card brand directory server. This field must be supplied for Mastercard Identity Check.

types.name: ThreeDSecureStatusCode
types.description: A raw 3D Secure PARes or VARes response code (e.g. 'Y').

types.name: ThreeDSecureVersion
types.description: A 3D Secure authentication version. Must be composed of digits separated by periods (e.g. '1.0.2').

types.name: Timestamp
types.description: An [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Times) timestamp with microsecond precision, in UTC.

types.name: Transaction
types.description: A charge on a payment method.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier.

fields.name: legacyId
fields.description: Legacy unique identifier.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the transaction was created.

fields.name: paymentMethodSnapshot
fields.description: Snapshot of payment method details used to create the transaction, preserved at the time the transaction was created. This will always be present.

fields.name: paymentMethod
fields.description: The multi-use payment method associated with the transaction. Only present if a multi-use payment method was used to create the transaction and it has not been deleted. The details of this PaymentMethod may have changed since the transaction was created; details used for the transaction can be found in the `paymentMethodSnapshot` field.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount charged in this transaction. For transactions that are partially captured, this amount will be the cummulative amount captured on this transaction. For transactions that are partially authorized, the amount will be less than the `initialRequestedAuthorizationAmount`.

fields.name: initialRequestedAuthorizationAmount
fields.description: The initial requested authorization amount for this transaction.

fields.name: customFields
fields.description: Collection of custom field/value pairs. Custom fields are [defined in the Control Panel](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/custom-fields#store-and-pass-back-fields).

fields.name: merchantId
fields.description: The ID of the merchant that processed this transaction.

fields.name: merchantAccountId
fields.description: The ID of the merchant account that processed this transaction.

fields.name: merchantName
fields.description: The display name of the merchant that processed this transaction.

fields.name: merchantAddress
fields.description: The address of the merchant that processed this transaction.

fields.name: orderId
fields.description: The order ID for this transaction. For PayPal transactions, the PayPal Invoice ID.

fields.name: purchaseOrderNumber
fields.description: A purchase order identification value you associate with this transaction.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of this transaction.

fields.name: processorResponse
fields.description: Fields describing the payment processor response.

fields.name: riskData
fields.description: Risk data evaluated for this transaction.

fields.name: descriptor
fields.description: Fields used to define what will appear on customers' credit card statements for a specific purchase.

fields.name: statusHistory
fields.description: The records of all statuses this transaction has passed through, with additional information on why each status occurred. Returned in reverse chronological order, with the most recent event first in the list.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: If the transaction request was performed through a shopping cart provider or Braintree partner, this field will have a string identifier for that shopping cart provider or partner. For PayPal transactions, this maps to the PayPal account's bn_code.

fields.name: source
fields.description: How the transaction was created.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: Customer associated with the transaction, if applicable.

fields.name: shipping
fields.description: Shipping information.

fields.name: tax
fields.description: Tax information.

fields.name: scaExemptionRequested
fields.description: The type of Strong Customer Authentication Exemption that was requested for this transaction.

fields.name: discountAmount
fields.description: Discount amount that was included in the total transaction amount.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: Line items for this transaction.

fields.name: refunds
fields.description: The list of refunds issued against this transaction.

fields.name: partialCaptureDetails
fields.description: For transactions created or captured using the `partialCaptureTransaction` mutation. This field links a given transaction to its original authorization or all its partial captures.

fields.name: disputes
fields.description: A collection of disputes associated with the transaction.

fields.name: facilitatorDetails
fields.description: If the transaction request was performed using payment information from a third party via the Grant API, Shared Vault or Google Pay, these fields will capture information about the third party. These fields are primarily useful for the merchant of record.

fields.name: disbursementDetails
fields.description: The disbursement details associated with this transaction. This field is only available after the transaction is SETTLED and if you have an eligible merchant account.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description: The billing address associated with the transaction.

fields.name: authorizationAdjustments
fields.description: A collection of AuthorizationAdjustments associated with the transaction.

fields.name: retried
fields.description: Whether or not the transaction was automatically retried by Braintree's internal systems.

fields.name: installmentDetails
fields.description: Installment details associated with the transaction.

fields.name: paymentInitiatedAt
fields.description: The transaction date and time as reported by the in-store payment terminal.

types.name: TransactionAuthorizationAdjustmentProcessorResponse
types.description: Record of processor response data received in response to authorization adjustment requests.

fields.name: legacyCode
fields.description: The [processor response code](https://developers.braintreepayments.com/reference/general/processor-responses/authorization-responses) indicating the result of attempting the adjustment.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The text explanation of the processor response code.

fields.name: declineType
fields.description: Whether or not the decline is the result of a temporary issue. Only present if adjustment is declined.

types.name: TransactionAuthorizationProcessorResponse
types.description: Detailed response information from the processor when attempting to authorize a transaction.

fields.name: legacyCode
fields.description: A code based on the response from the processor, indicating the result of attempting to authorize this transaction. See the [list of possible processor response codes for authorization](https://developers.braintreepayments.com/reference/general/processor-responses/authorization-responses).

fields.name: message
fields.description: The text explanation of the processor response legacyCode.

fields.name: cvvResponse
fields.description: The processing bank's response to the provided CVV.

fields.name: avsPostalCodeResponse
fields.description: The processing bank's response to the provided billing postal or zip code.

fields.name: avsStreetAddressResponse
fields.description: The processing bank's response to the provided billing street address.

fields.name: authorizationId
fields.description: The processor's unique ID or "code" for the authorization.

fields.name: additionalInformation
fields.description: If present, any additional information recieved from the processor. May provide further insight into the `legacyCode`.

fields.name: retrievalReferenceNumber
fields.description: The processor's reference number for the authorization.

fields.name: emvData
fields.description: Response EMV data provided by the processor if this was an EMV transaction.

types.name: TransactionConnection
types.description: A paginated list of transactions.

fields.name: edges
fields.description: A list of transactions.

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Information about the page of transactions contained in `edges`.

types.name: TransactionExternalVaultOptionsInput
types.description: Input for transactions created with credit cards vaulted in an external vault, not the Braintree Vault. Do not use for transactions created from Braintree multi-use payment methods, or from single-use payment methods which will not be stored in an external vault.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: The credit card's assocation with an external vault.

inputFields.name: verifyingNetworkTransactionId
inputFields.description: The network transaction ID of the first _transaction_ after which this payment method was stored in the external vault. If the `status` is `WILL_VAULT`, do not pass this value; the network transaction ID of the resulting transaction can be passed in this field for _subsequent_ transactions. If the `status` is `VAULTED`, but the customer is directly initiating the charge, do not pass this value.

types.name: TransactionInput
types.description: Input fields for creating a transaction.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: Billing amount of the request. This value must be greater than 0, and must match the currency format of the merchant account. This can only contain numbers and one decimal point (e.g. x.xx). Can't be greater than the maximum allowed by the processor.

inputFields.name: merchantAccountId
inputFields.description: Merchant account ID used to process the transaction. Currency is also determined by merchant account ID. If no merchant account ID is specified, we will use your default merchant account.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: Additional information about the transaction. On PayPal transactions, this field maps to the PayPal invoice number. PayPal invoice numbers must be unique in your PayPal business account. Maximum 255 characters or 127 for PayPal transactions.

inputFields.name: exchangeRateQuoteId
inputFields.description: ID of exchange rate quote to be used for the transaction.

inputFields.name: purchaseOrderNumber
inputFields.description:
A purchase order identification value you associate with this transaction.

*Required for Level 2 processing*.

inputFields.name: riskData
inputFields.description: Customer device information, which is sent directly to supported processors for fraud analysis.

inputFields.name: customFields
inputFields.description: Collection of custom field/value pairs. You must [set up each custom field in the Control Panel](https://articles.braintreepayments.com/control-panel/custom-fields#creating-a-custom-field) prior to passing it with a request.

inputFields.name: descriptor
inputFields.description: Fields used to define what will appear on a customer's bank statement for a specific purchase.

inputFields.name: recurring
inputFields.description: Deprecated: This field is included for supporting legacy clients. Please use `paymentInitiator` instead.

inputFields.name: paymentInitiator
inputFields.description: The initiator of the payment. Payment can either be merchant-initiated or customer-initiated. If the transaction is an ecommerce transaction initiated by the customer, no value is passed.

inputFields.name: channel
inputFields.description: For partners and shopping carts only. If you are a shopping cart provider or other Braintree partner, pass a string identifier for your service. For PayPal transactions, this maps to paypal.bn_code.

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: If charging a single-use payment method, optional ID of a customer to associate the transaction with. If vaulting the single-use payment method, this customer will be associated with the resulting multi-use payment method.

inputFields.name: shipping
inputFields.description:
Shipping information.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: tax
inputFields.description:
Tax information about the transaction.

*Required for Level 2 processing*.

inputFields.name: discountAmount
inputFields.description:
Discount amount that was included in the total transaction amount. Does not add to the total amount the payment method will be charged. This value can't be negative. Please note that this field is not used on PayPal transactions.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: lineItems
inputFields.description:
Line items for this transaction. Up to 249 line items may be specified.

*Required for Level 3 processing*.

inputFields.name: threeDSecurePassThrough
inputFields.description:
Deprecated: This field is included for supporting legacy clients. This field is specific to credit card payment methods only, and cannot be applied to transactions with other payment method types. If you need to pass this field, please use `authorizeCreditCard` or `chargeCreditCard`. See the `CreditCardTransactionOptionsInput` type for details.

Results of a merchant-performed 3D Secure authentication. You will only need to use these fields if you've performed your own integration with a 3D Secure MPI provider (e.g. Cardinal Centinel). Otherwise, Braintree's SDKs handle this for you in our standard 3D Secure integration.

inputFields.name: vaultPaymentMethodAfterTransacting
inputFields.description: When a single-use payment method is used to create this transaction, it can be automatically stored in the vault after transacting. If this field is left blank, the single-use payment method will not be vaulted.

inputFields.name: customerDetails
inputFields.description:
Customer information to be stored on the transaction and used for fraud protection. Use this if you wish to pass customer information on a transaction without creating an independent stored customer record in the vault.

This parameter can only be used if you do not pass `customerId`, and if you are not using a vaulted/multi-use payment method. In other words, this field is only valid when the transaction will not be associated with an existing customer.

If `vaultPaymentMethodAfterTransacting` is also passed, these values will be used when creating a new customer for the newly-vaulted payment method.

enumValues.description: Verification conducted independently by the merchant, not through Braintree.

enumValues.name: MICRO_TRANSFERS
enumValues.description: Verification by micro-deposits transferred to the bank account, which the customer must then confirm. The most reliable method, but takes additional time.

enumValues.description: Verification at the point of tokenization. Requires integration with a third-party provider. Because this requires a different tokenization flow, this method of verification is only supported for vaulting tokenized US bank account logins, and is not supported when re-verifying a US bank account payment method.

inputFields.description: Results of a merchant-performed 3D Secure authentication. You will only need to use these fields if you've performed your own integration with a 3D Secure MPI provider (e.g. Cardinal Centinel). Otherwise, Braintree's SDKs handle this for you in our standard 3D Secure integration.

types.name: VaultCreditCardVerificationOptionsInput
types.description: Input fields that specify options for verifying the vaulted credit card.

inputFields.name: merchantAccountId
inputFields.description: ID of the merchant account to use when verifying the credit card. The verification will use the default merchant account if this field is left blank.

inputFields.name: skip
inputFields.description: Whether to opt out of verifying the credit card. Defaults to `false` for credit cards that support verification. Clients should only pass `true` in the uncommon scenario that the credit card has been verified externally to Braintree.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount to use to verify the credit card.

inputFields.name: fraudTools
inputFields.description: Control which fraud tools will be applied to this transaction. Fraud tools cannot be retroactively applied to a transaction if skipped.

types.name: Verification
types.description: A verification reporting whether the payment method has passed your fraud rules and the issuer has ensured it is associated with a valid account.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier.

fields.name: legacyId
fields.description: Legacy unique identifier.

fields.name: paymentMethodSnapshot
fields.description: Snapshot of payment method details that were verified. This will always be present.

fields.name: paymentMethod
fields.description: The multi-use payment method that was verified, if it was vaulted. The details of this PaymentMethod may have changed since it was verified.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: For a credit card, the amount used when performing the verification.
fields.deprecationReason: Depending on the type of payment method being verified, some verifications do not have an amount. On a credit card verification, use `paymentMethodVerificationDetails.amount` instead.

fields.name: merchantAccountId
fields.description: The merchant account used for the verification.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of this verification, indicating whether the verification was successful. Braintree recommends only vaulting payment methods that are successfully verified.

fields.name: processorResponse
fields.description: Detailed response information from the processor. Will not be present if the verification was rejected prior to contacting the processor.

fields.name: networkResponse
fields.description: Fields describing the network response to the verification request.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time at which the verification was created.

fields.name: gatewayRejectionReason
fields.description: The reason the verification was rejected. This will only be set if status is GATEWAY_REJECTED.

fields.name: riskData
fields.description: Risk data evaluated for this verification.

fields.name: paymentMethodVerificationDetails
fields.description: Details unique to the verification based on payment method type being verified.

fields.description: The verification's location within the VerificationConnection. Used for requesting additional pages.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The verification.

types.description: A union of all possible verification details specific to the type of payment method being verified.

types.description: Detailed response information from the processor.

fields.name: message

fields.name: avsStreetAddressResponse

types.name: VerificationStatus
types.description: The status of the verification, indicating whether the payment method was successfully verified. Braintree recommends only vaulting payment methods with successful verifications.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: Indicates the verification was unsuccessful because of an issue communicating with the processor.

enumValues.name: GATEWAY_REJECTED
enumValues.description: Indicates that the verification was unsuccessful because the payment method failed one or more fraud checks. In this case, the `gatewayRejectionReason` will indicate which fraud check failed.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Indicates that the verification is pending.

enumValues.name: PROCESSOR_DECLINED
enumValues.description: Indicates that the verification was unsuccessful based on the response from the processor.

enumValues.name: VERIFIED
enumValues.description: Indicates that the verification was successful.

enumValues.name: VERIFYING
enumValues.description: Indicates that the verification is in the process of verifying.
